name: Lake Ladoga
hint: Largest lake in Europe, located in northwestern Russia near St. Petersburg

name: Lake Geneva
hint: Crescent-shaped lake on the Swiss-French border, home to the Jet d'Eau

name: Lake Balaton
hint: Largest lake in Central Europe, known as the Hungarian Sea

name: Lake Como
hint: Deep glacial lake in the Italian Alps, popular celebrity retreat

name: Loch Ness
hint: Famous Scottish lake known for its legendary monster

name: Lake Constance
hint: Lake bordered by Germany, Austria, and Switzerland

name: Lake Vanern
hint: Largest lake in Sweden and the EU

name: Lake Saimaa
hint: Largest lake in Finland, home to the endangered Saimaa ringed seal

name: Lake Garda
hint: Largest lake in Italy, located between Venice and Milan

name: Lake Ohrid
hint: One of the oldest lakes in the world, on the North Macedonia-Albania border

name: Lake Onega
hint: Second-largest lake in Europe, in northwestern Russia near Karelia

name: Lake Lucerne
hint: Scenic Swiss lake surrounded by mountains, linked to the founding of Switzerland

name: Lake Bled
hint: Fairy-tale Slovenian lake with a tiny island church and a clifftop medieval castle

name: Lake Zurich
hint: Banana-shaped Swiss lake in the heart of Zurich, popular for swimming and boating

name: Loch Lomond
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Great Britain by surface area, in the Scottish Highlands

name: Lake Neuchatel
hint: Largest lake entirely within Switzerland, at the foot of the Jura Mountains

name: Lake Mjosa
hint: Largest lake in Norway, stretching north from the Lillehammer region

name: Lake Maggiore
hint: Second-largest Italian lake, straddling the Swiss-Italian border with beautiful islands

name: Plitvice Lakes
hint: Stunning cascading turquoise lakes in Croatia, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Lake Peipus
hint: Fifth-largest lake in Europe, on the Estonia-Russia border, site of a famous 1242 battle
